ai_choice.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Warrington - Choice
ai_choice.match: Building work - check the approval you need | warrington.gov.uk
ai_choice.reason: The customer wants to make small changes to his flat and needs a simple online form to request permission, which is addressed in this page that explains checking if planning permission or building regulation approval is needed.

ai_page.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Warrington - Page
ai_page.body:
Building work - check the approval you need

Before you make improvements always check if you need planning permission, building regulation approval or both. If you go ahead without permission or approval, you may end up having to put things back to how they were.

Do you need building regulation approval?

As well as getting planning permission you may need separate approval for a new building, extension or major alteration. Your work needs to reach certain standards so that the building is safe and energy efficient.

Generally you’ll need building control approval for:

  • new buildings
  • extensions
  • loft conversions
  • changes to the structure of the building
  • change the use of buildings
  • home improvements such as a new boiler, radiators, bathroom, fuse box, electric, windows, doors and roofing

You can find out more on the Local Authority Building Control website

Apply for building regulation approval

Apply for building regulation approval

Planning permission

You’ll generally need planning permission if you want to:

  • build something new
  • building an extension
  • change the current use of your building

The Planning Portal website and their interactive guidance for householders will tell you more about when you do and when you don’t need planning permission.

Planning Portal interactive guidance is displayed on this website using an iframe. If your browser cannot display iframes or they are blocked, you will see this message. You can view all the interactive guides on the Planning Portal: https://www.planningportal.co.uk/permission

Contact Building Control

If you need to contact the Planning team, please visit the Planning section of our website – we cannot reply to questions for the Planning team.
You can contact our Building Control team by sending us a message or calling us, our offices are open from 9am to 5pm, Monday to Friday.
You can call the Building Control team on 01925 442554 or email [email protected]

Send a message to Building Control

Planning questions:
Our Building Control team cannot reply to planning questions. You’ll need to get in touch with our Planning team. Please visit the Planning section of our website.

The information that you provide will only be used for the purpose of responding to the matter that you have contacted us about. The information will not be shared or used for any other purposes other than dealing with your query. For more information on how your data will be used please see our Privacy Policy.

3 July 2023

ai_business_case.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Warrington - Business Case
ai_business_case.letter:
To the CEO,

Based on our recent review of the customer persona, site content, feedback, and identified issues, I recommend targeted improvements to enhance service efficiency, improve user satisfaction, and potentially reduce operational costs.

Customer Persona & Needs:
David, a typical council tenant aged 52, uses online services comfortably but prefers clear, straightforward digital interactions. His primary goal is to apply for permission to make small improvements to his flat, such as installing a kitchen or handrail. He is concerned about delays and missing updates, indicating a need for transparent, timely communication.

Current Page Content & Feedback:
The page titled "Building work - check the approval you need" contains vital information about planning and building regulation permissions. However, feedback has identified clarity issues, particularly with headings, sentence structure, and resource accessibility.

Specific Issues & Recommendations:

1. Heading Clarity:
- Issue: The current heading ("Building work - check the approval you need") is somewhat generic.
- Improvement: Change to "How to get approval for your flat improvements."
- Impact: A specific, action-oriented heading immediately informs users of the page’s purpose, increasing engagement and reducing confusion.

2. Sentence Structure & Readability:
- Issue: The sentence "Before you make improvements always check if you need planning permission, building regulation approval or both" is lengthy and complex.
- Improvement: Break it into shorter sentences: "Before making improvements, check if you need planning permission, building regulation approval, or both."
- Impact: Improved clarity and quicker comprehension, helping users determine their next steps more efficiently.

3. Resource Linking & Accessibility:
- Issue: The link to additional resources is embedded in text, which may reduce visibility.
- Improvement: Replace with a prominent, clickable button or clearly labeled link, such as "Learn more about building control approvals."
- Impact: Increased accessibility and user engagement, leading to more informed customers who can complete their processes faster and with less frustration.

Overall, refining language clarity, enhancing navigation cues, and streamlining information presentation will directly benefit users like David—making the process more straightforward, reducing the likelihood of delays, and minimizing unnecessary administrative inquiries. These improvements can lead to reduced workload for staff, faster decision-making, and a better overall experience, aligning with our goal to maximize service efficiency and cost savings.

I strongly recommend the web team prioritize these content and usability enhancements.

Best regards,

[Your Name]
Web Usability Expert and Web Manager
